function.name: ALL_OF
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function between specific primitive values and a bag of values, and SHALL return True if and only if the predicate is True for at least one element of the bag. It takes n+1 arguments, where n is one or greater. The first argument names a Boolean function that takes n arguments of primitive types. Under the remaining n arguments, n-1 parameters are values of primitive data-types and one is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the function named in the first argument is applied to the n-1 non-bag arguments and each element of the bag argument and the results are combined with an AND

function.name: ANY_OF_ANY
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function on each tuple from the cross product on all bags arguments, and returns True if and only if the predicate is True for at least one inside-function call. This function takes n+1 arguments, where n is one or greater. The first argument is a <Function> element that names a Boolean function that takes n arguments. The remaining arguments are either primitive data types or bags of primitive types. The expression is evaluated as if the function named in the first argument was applied between every tuple of the cross product on all bags and the primitive values, and the results were combined using OR. The semantics are that the result of the expression will be True if and only if the applied predicate is True for at least one function call on the tuples from the bags and primitive values.

function.name: ANY_OF_ALL
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function between the elements of two bags. The expression will be True if and only if the supplied predicate is True between each element of the second bag and any element of the first bag. This function takes three arguments. The first argument is a <Function> element that names a Boolean function that takes two arguments of primitive types. The second argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The third argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the ANY_OF function had been applied to each value of the second bag and the whole of the first bag using the supplied function, and the results were then combined using AND

function.name: ANY_OF
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function between specific primitive values and a bag of values, and SHALL return True if and only if the predicate is True for at least one element of the bag. It takes n+1 arguments, where n is one or greater. The first argument names a Boolean function that takes n arguments of primitive types. Under the remaining n arguments, n-1 parameters are values of primitive data-types and one is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the function named in the first argument is applied to the n-1 non-bag arguments and each element of the bag argument and the results are combined with an OR.

function.name: ALL_OF_ANY
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function between the elements of two bags. The expression will be True if and only if the supplied predicate is True between each element of the first bag and any element of the second bag. This function takes three arguments. The first argument is a <Function> element that names a Boolean function that takes two arguments of primitive types. The second argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The third argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the ANY_OF function had been applied to each value of the first bag and the whole of the second bag using the supplied function, and the results were then combined using AND

function.name: ALL_OF_ALL
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function between the elements of two bags. The expression will be True if and only if the supplied predicate is True between each and every element of the first bag collectively against all the elements of the second bag. This function takes three arguments. The first argument is a <Function> element that names a Boolean function that takes two arguments of primitive types. The second argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The third argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the function named in the first element were applied between every element of the second argument and every element of the third argument and the results were combined using AND. The semantics are that the result of the expression is True if and only if the applied predicate is True for all elements of the first bag compared to all the elements of the second bag.

function.name: MAP
function.description: This function converts a bag of values to another bag of values. This function takes n+1 arguments, where n is one or greater. The first argument is a <Function> element naming a function that takes a n arguments of a primitive data-type and returns a value of a primitive data-type Under the remaining n arguments, n-1 parameters are values of primitive data-types and one is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the function named in the first argument were applied to the n-1 non-bag arguments and each element of the bag argument and resulting in a bag of the converted value. The result is a bag of the primitive data-type that is returned by the function named in the first element.
